page.title: 13Local News- N.W.Edinburgh
page.content: The following items were taken from the{Edinburgh Evening News}dated {15th May 1985. Local pensioners can go for a dip every Monday between 10.30 and 11.30 in the pool at{Craigroyston Community {School.}A few are swimming for the first time ever. Some find that the gentle exercise of swimming helps to ease the aches and pains caused by arthritis and makes them fitter and healthier. A man appeared at the{High Court}in {Edinburgh}charged with drug offences. He had heroin in a flat at{47/6 {Muirhouse Park}and he intended to supply it to others. He had 8 previous convictions. The judge said that the courts have made it plain that penalties for people trafficking in drugs should now be severe. The man was jailed for five years.
